title: Daniel Arias Ocampo
text:
Business Analyst

isaac@applesdofall.org | My wikipedia page



I am a trilingual student in Spanish, Tagalog, and English. My professional experience includes Marketing; Financial Analysis; Project Management; and Business Analytics. Strong leadership skills. Collaborator who coordinates individual strengths to deliver a solid product. Knowledge and experience with Analytics Programs.



Bachelor in Business Analytics



Data Engineer (April 2024- July 2024) Extensiv Sandy, Utah
• Developed and maintained 10+ interactive dashboards to visualize key performance indicators for a third-party logistics (3PL) company, enhancing decision-making processes and operational efficiency.
• Contributed to the optimization of data collection and storage processes, reducing data retrieval times, and improving system performance.
• Performed detailed analysis of large datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for process improvements within the logistics domain.
Course Analyst (April 2022- December 2022) BYU-Idaho Rexburg, Idaho
• Analyzed quantitative and qualitative data from student assessments, surveys, and course evaluations, producing 10+ actionable reports a week to guide evidence-based decision-making.
• Conducted 8+ detailed course audits daily to ensure clearness and accuracy of material causing improvement in 10+ courses.
• Utilized weekly data-driven insights to recommend modifications to course structures, assessments, and activities, enhancing engagement and student performance.
Personal Finance Teacher Assistant (January 2023-July 2024) BYU-Idaho Rexburg, Idaho
• Analyzed quantitative and qualitative data from student assessments, surveys, and course evaluations, producing 10+ actionable reports a week to guide evidence-based decision-making.
• Conducted 8+ detailed course audits daily to ensure clearness and accuracy of material causing improvement in 10+ courses.
• Utilized weekly data-driven insights to recommend modifications to course structures, assessments, and activities, enhancing engagement and student performance.



Full-Time Representative (March 2019- April 2020) The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints Quezon City, Philippines
• Monitored and lead groups of 15-20 volunteers to ensure quality control deriving in a better and more clear understanding about the purpose of the volunteering experience.
• Completed 60+ work hours a week with people from varied backgrounds and cultures, helping to develop teamwork.



• SQL, ALTERYX, Tableau, Power BI, Python, Meticulous.
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with diligence and accuracy
• Strong Pyhton and R Studio Analytical Skills
